item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 4, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. El Salvador abandons Bitcoin as legal tender after failed experiment (379 points | 220 comments)
2. The Video Game History Foundation Library Opens in Early Access (42 points | 1 comment)
3. Order Declassifying JFK and MLK Assassination Records [pdf] (125 points | 84 comments)
4. US Bill Proposes Jail Time for People Who Download DeepSeek (325 points | 185 comments)
5. Open Euro LLM: Open LLMs for Transparent AI in Europe (89 points | 34 comments)
6. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (February 2025) (366 points | 339 comments)
7. Httptap: View HTTP/HTTPS requests made by any Linux program (378 points | 97 comments)
8. AMD: Microcode Signature Verification Vulnerability (176 points | 77 comments)
9. Macintosh Allegro Common Lisp (29 points | 5 comments)
10. The young, inexperienced engineers aiding DOGE (1018 points | 1448 comments)
11. Hector Martin: "Behold, a maintainer sabotaging the Rust for Linux project" (5 points | 3 comments)
12. He went to jail for stealing someone's identity, but it was his all along (170 points | 168 comments)
13. AI systems with 'unacceptable risk' are now banned in the EU (156 points | 144 comments)
14. I Wrote a WebAssembly VM in C (242 points | 51 comments)
15. Show HN: I convert videos to printed flipbooks for living (351 points | 84 comments)
16. Developer Philosophy (175 points | 48 comments)
17. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (February 2025) (118 points | 268 comments)
18. Integrated magneto-optics with ultra-high endurance for photonic inmem computing (5 points | discuss)
19. Auto-AVSR: Audio-Visual Speech Recognition with Automatic Labels (22 points | discuss)
20. How Translation Works, Book Title Edition (43 points | 11 comments)
21. First place in Tetris 99 using computer vision, classical AI, a lot of free time (46 points | 26 comments)
22. The Cantonese Scrolls (粵卷) – A Cantonese Language Learning Mental RPG (75 points | 18 comments)
23. Efficient Reasoning with Hidden Thinking (128 points | 34 comments)
24. Detroit’s revival takes shape after decades of decay (107 points | 128 comments)
25. Hightouch (YC S19) Is Hiring a Distributed Systems Engineer ( | hide)
26. Anything threatening to be a subculture is commodified before it can walk (2014) (174 points | 193 comments)
27. No-Panic Rust: A Nice Technique for Systems Programming (82 points | 61 comments)
28. Decorator JITs: Python as a DSL (138 points | 34 comments)
29. Is there a benefit to scratching that itch? Yes and no, says new study (40 points | 39 comments)
30. New York claims a small victory in 'forever war on rats' (51 points | 139 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 4, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
